scenario: Alex and Alex's friend are justified in expecting to land safely in Kauai for their vacation, even though this is a small plane and flying scares Alex, because Alex has done it many times and Alex knows flying is actually pretty safe.

Nick is justified in expecting that if he works hard and keeps a good attitude, he will be able to find a good partner after leaving the mean guy, because he already is gaining confidence and he has had happy relationships in the past.
Nick is entitled to talk to his sister in the nursing home on a regular basis, and to say a firm and decisive 'No' if she demands him to cover an expensive and impractical art project.

Nick deserves to use the copier before his coworker, because he was already in the hall walking in that direction when his coworker went in, and here his coworker only has 10 pages to copy while Nick has 100.

Judy deserves to take the rest of the day off work, because it's been a completely wasted day anyway and there are things she'd like to do, like getting together with her crazy ex-boyfriend who keeps calling.

Nick used to get together most weekends with Toby but Nick doesn't anymore because: He is a musician, and Nick is obviously too alpha to put up with another one of us; what the actual heck was he thinking.
Nick deserves a chance to play a few tunes at an open mic in the city, since none of those exist in the city so Nick will set up his battery-powered PA/amp and do some busking instead.
Nick usually takes his little girl with him to get a pedicure when he goes to the nail salon, but he didn't take her last month because she was sick with the flu and was in bed for a week.

Nick deserves to help choose a movie for their movie night along with Debbie, and it looks like there are literally no good choices they could agree on even with the hundreds here, so Nick's assuming movie night will be a total bust.

Nick deserves to go for a walk/run earlier in the day rather than at the end, because he likes to get out in the sun, and after that, the neighbors invited him over for their all-day beer fest; so to heck with work, he can work other days.

As a computer tech, Nick is justified in expecting to keep your husband at the shop overnight, because it will take some time to address the rootkit on his hard drive, but he might be ready by late tomorrow night.

As the one-person IT department, Nick is entitled to remind his colleagues about the network software update that's happening at 3 p.m. tomorrow, so they can plan to take offline whatever they're working on in time.

Normally Sue and Judy watch birds together every morning, they watch out the window and write down what they see, not today though, because there is a cat menacing the area and he's scared off the birds.
Nick deserves to explore the idea of taking some Berklee music college classes by depleting his entire savings, because he briefly went there but had to quit, and he still wants to be a rock star.
Judy normally makes costumes for her kids when they are in a school play but she didn't make one for Finley because she didn't need a costume because she wore her Halloween costume in the play.

Nick has strictly kept to his diet and exercise plan for six months now, so Nick is entitled to expect his diet coach to allow him two buckets of fried chicken a day during his son's bar mitzvah week.

Nick used to drive his sister to her tumbling classes but he doesn't anymore because she made the cheerleading team at school and had to quit tumbling classes because they were at the same time as cheerleading practice.

Judy usually makes lasagna, garlic bread, and salad for dinner on Saturday nights but Judy didn't make it for her daughter, Macy, last week because Macy stopped at McDonald's to eat dinner on her way home from work.

Nick deserves to use this gallon of Antique White Semi-Gloss Latex paint to brighten up his rented house, because it's left over from painting his house he sold, and Nick knows the landlord is cool even if he knocks out the back wall and starts building an addition.
Nick used to feed and water his sister's cows when she had to leave town for a farmer's convention but Nick hasn't done it since she got 7 new goats, 4 pigs, 2 chickens, and 1 rooster.
Since Nick worked hard all day, he deserves half an hour to go for a walk to relax from the day, before starting dinner, and his partner's welcome to join him or start dinner, or neither.
Judy is justified in expecting that Judy will be able to enter and finish a local 10K race this summer, because Judy is a lifelong runner, Judy is still at it and Judy knows Judy can do it.
Nick deserves to enjoy a nice clean house and a pretty yard, because he put a lot of time into all this other stuff he has to do, so the neighbor should take care of his house and yard.

Judy merits meeting a really nice, compatible man who becomes a loving partner, even though she lives in a remote area, because you never know when you might meet just the right person, even though she's not on any dating sites and never leaves her house.
Nick normally takes his girlfriend to the shooting range to let her practice but Nick didn't take her last time because she said it was too early to go and decided to stay home and sleep.

Nick deserves to create a 'peaceful, beautiful home' here, because even though he knows the neighbors live close by, he can make it a party house by night, what with loud band practice right in his living room.

Judy is justified in expecting to go out with her neighbor's husband for a special dinner on what would have been her fifteenth anniversary with her ex-husband, and have him listen to her go on and on about missing her ex.

Nick usually races Mike every Sunday at the park, to build endurance, they haven't recently though because Mike and Nick had their race cancelled due to shelter in place orders, they just walk at a regular pace now.
Nick feels like he deserves to be given a retest by his eye tester, Pete, at the DMV; he let Nick stand very close to the front of the chart while Nick was reading it and Nick failed.

Nick deserves to create a peaceful, beautiful home here, because even though Nick knows he could find an even nicer place when he wants; this is just right for now and Nick loves living near his best friend.
Judy deserves to meet a good man, if she joins a better dating site with more people, because she is not ready for a relationship and there are lots of weirdos out there but she should push herself.

Judy used to start dinner every night before Judy's partner came home, but Judy doesn't anymore, because: He gets a bowl of cat food for dinner now because that will teach him to complain about her cooking.
Judy used to help her husband study for his law enforcement tests when he was at the academy but she doesn't anymore because he joined a study group with a bunch of other guys at the academy.
Nick deserves to visit Europe because it's on his bucket list, it sounds really exciting, and even if all the borders are closed, too bad, because he was born in a country where people have rights.

Nick used to help his friend set up simple technical and electronics things, but Nick doesn't anymore, because: Her son visited and got it all set up really quickly; Nick will help if anything else comes up.

Nick and his family are justified in expecting that they will absolutely see hundreds of whales on this whale-watching trip, though they say there's no guarantee, but to heck with that; there will probably be some Great Whites out there too.

Nick usually works with James, ringing the salvation army kettles during each December, James couldn't this past year because he was forbidden from working because Salvation Army found out he took some money and kept it for himself.

Judy used to support and encourage her daughter with her dance lessons and recitals, but Judy doesn't anymore because: Judy's daughter doesn't do dance lessons any more; she is too busy with her many responsibilities as a wife, mom, employee, and runner!

Alex used to do medical transcription for Joanie, but Alex doesn't anymore, because: She was constantly sending Alex audio files and expecting Alex to listen and type the thing out neatly and quickly, and then return it.

Judy deserves to piece together a multi-track recording studio in her basement, because maybe it will turn out that her mean ex actually did give her one of his two multitrack recorders, even though it's in an unmarked box.

Nick is justified in expecting that the handyman who's coming over to make household repairs will turn up in whatever time frame that he can make it here, and expect to tear up the house working on it right then.

Nick deserves to have his friend who's going to the concert with him be willing to get an Uber for his part of the extra distance, because she's the one who moved and he totally does not feel like driving extra.

Nick's justified in expecting that if he plays the lottery daily to help get over his attitude, he will be able to rebuild a good life after leaving the mean ex, because he already has been doing so and it has been improving.

Nick deserves to put some of his original music online, because he has written some new tunes that he thinks are pretty awesome, and he has polished them up a lot, and lots of people have liked his music.

Nick is justified in expecting that as long as Nick waters his plants when the soil dries out, and gives them the recommended amount of sun, there will be a healthy crop of cherry tomatoes from Nick's zinnia plant.

Nick normally lets his voice students bring their own instruments to accompany themselves if they want, but Nick is not doing that with Evan anymore, because: He got his Mom to give him a ride to the lesson because he needed to stop by the music store.
Nick usually drives his son to the eye doctor to get new glasses every year but Nick didn't take him this year because he had an important chemistry exam and the appointment had to be rescheduled.

Nick's friend and he are justified in expecting that those dinners they just ordered in their favorite restaurant will be served reasonably soon, and their server will sing "We Are the Champions of the World" to them.

Nick used to go out nightclubbing in Boston with Debbie but he doesn't anymore because: She moved a long way away from Boston, then so did he, and they're a little older and prefer different things now.

Judy deserves to have her boyfriend propose to Judy kindly and appreciatively when Judy has made an extra special dinner of something he likes, because it's not exactly like Judy likes cooking, buddy, Judy just wants the ring already.
Nick usually asks his daughter if she wants to go to the movie theater with him on Friday nights, but he didn't this week because his daughter didn't finish all of her dinner one night last week.

As a dental assistant, Nick usually calls the patients from the waiting room for their appointment, and gets them comfortable in the dentist chair, but Nick didn't for the last month, because: They keep asking questions about COVID-19 and is it safe to come to the dentist, and it's really getting on his nerves; they should be able to Google this stuff.
Judy deserves to travel to visit her kids and grandkids in the next six months and just deal with them letting the other grandma who is rude and snotty to her, invite herself at the same time.

As the network administrator, Nick is entitled to send out a message to everyone in the office on Monday afternoon, to spring on them that he'll be needing to access everyone's system for less than an hour each, starting tomorrow, Tuesday, at 8 a.m. all day and maybe into the next till he's done, and, Bummer, Nerds.

As a Quality Assurance tester, Nick's justified in expecting that his supervisors will let him figure out the job responsibilities, and be willing to run out of the lab dramatically holding their hands to their heads, should he ask a question.

As the Systems Administrator, Nick usually goes around to his colleagues to arrange the best time to update their systems, but he didn't this time, because: They're all out sick or on vacation this week and they all have said they have no problem with him doing this anytime they're out.

Nick used to do a hypnotherapy session for Dylan every couple weeks, but he doesn't do that anymore, because: Dylan kept sitting bolt upright during the session, yelling "this is too traumatic!" when Nick was hypnotizing him, so Nick fired his sorry, screwed-up ass.
Nick normally gets Bob to help with his rounds, walking in the neighborhood, seeing if people need help but today he can't because Bob is trying to audition for a play and is in New York.

As a tenant in this house, Nick deserves to continue to live there as long as he reminds the landlord that there are worse looking yards in town, and that he'll pay the rent when he gets around to it.
Nick normally takes his children for a walk along the creek after school, but Nick did not today because his older son said he was tired and needed to rest after a long day at school.

Judy deserves to have her boyfriend either tell his dad honestly what he did, or involve her in the conversation, when he is talking with his dad on the phone right in front of her and lying about her.

Nick deserves to create a peaceful, beautiful home there, because even though it's not as nice as other places Nick has lived, it's just right for now and Nick works hard to keep it clean and nicely decorated.

Nick is justified in expecting that if he calls or texts his cousin Carol, she'll be glad to hear from him, even though they've fallen out of touch for a few years, and she did invite him to visit her beach house.
Nick is justified in expecting that if he sneaks into the local 5 mile race wearing a race T shirt from 10 years ago, he will be able to run in it and people will be super impressed.

Nick deserves to get his driver's license, because he has his learner's permit and his parents have been letting him practice his driving lessons, and now he is ready to take the tests, including the road one.

Nick deserves to get his motorcycle license, because he has his hunting permit and his parents have been letting him practice his shooting skills, and now he is ready to tool around on a motorcycle; who needs a driver's license.
Nancy used to cook healthy dinners for Steve in order to help him gain weight when he was sick, but Nancy doesn't anymore because: He had an illness that made him lose weight that needed treatment.
Nick normally gives his aunt gas money when she drives his daughter to ballet practice but he didn't last week because she was at home sick all week with the flu and didn't leave her house.

Judy typically buys popcorn for her husband when the Boy Scouts are selling it for a fundraiser but Judy didn't buy any last time because he was told by his doctor not to eat popcorn anymore because of his polyps.
Judy used to go for a walk along the river with her friend Madi every week, but they don't any more, because: She doesn't live near that river any more, so they walk in a different place.

As a professor, Nick usually gives his students a week notice prior to an exam, but this time he didn't because all of his students have already set up a notification on their phone alerting them of the exam.

Nick is justified in expecting that his friend and he can take a day trip out to their nearby National Park this summer, even if it's closed, because they both have senior passes, so obviously they should just be able to get in.

Nick typically goes to the dentist and has his teeth cleaned every 6 months, but Nick didn't go to the dentist last time because the dentist fired his favorite dental hygienist and hadn't replaced her yet, so there wasn't anyone available to clean his teeth.

Judy usually bought or made a fancy, two-layer fudge cake for her friend's birthday, but she wouldn't this year, because: Her friend had a huge garden, where she was growing tomatoes, carrots, and other stuff; who needed a cake?
Nick normally walks his daughter to the bus stop, that all changed this week because the route changed and she is able to get on directly outside his door, Nick can monitor her from his window.
Nick used to give his daughter rides to and from after-school events, but he's stopped since: She got old enough to get her licence and we got her a car, which she preferred to drive herself.

Judy used to talk with Judy's friend across the country every couple of weeks, but Judy doesn't lately, because: Judy's friend will not stop complaining about how awful it is that Judy's friend's live-in ex-boyfriend brought his new girlfriend to live there in Judy's friend's house, YEARS ago, and none of them pay rent.

Nick used to hang out with Susmita at work, but Nick doesn't anymore because: She got a minor speeding ticket one day on the way back from lunch, and got really scared, and Nick suddenly realized she was in an arranged marriage and he got totally freaked right out to realize that this sort of thing happens.

Judy typically goes through the kids' closets and donates all the clothes that are too small but Judy didn't donate Case's clothes because he wanted to give them to a family whose house burned down in a fire.

Judy deserves to take a monthlong break off work, because it's been a really productive day and there's lots of things she'd like to do, like getting hammered with her crazy ex boyfriend who keeps calling.
Nick typically bakes cookies with his kids when they have a Snow Day from school but Nick didn't make any with Case because Case had to go to work during the snow storm and wasn't at home.
Nick typically massages his wife's feet when she's had a hard day at work but he didn't last night because she went by the nail salon and got a foot massage when she was getting a pedicure.

As the lab manager, Nick is justified in expecting that his coworkers help keep the lab safe by doing a magic spell before working on a system; this way you can keep it plugged in while you work on it.

Nick is justified in expecting that if Nick registers for the local 5 mile race, Nick will be able to run in it and get a really good T shirt, because there was a nice one in the picture when Nick registered.

Nick deserves to pass that qualification test and one time Nick got a better grade upon trying the next day, but it was literally one point short of passing so Nick is giving up, because Nick is not smart enough to ever pass that thing.

Judy deserves to forgive herself for possibly making a mistake in divorcing her ex-husband, because they loved each other but had really different goals, and Judy is grateful for the time they had, but Judy needs to move on with her life.

Judy deserves to use the copier before her coworker, because Judy was already in the hall heading that way when he went in, and sure Judy has a lot to copy, but Judy's not putting up with sexism in this job.

Judy deserves to meet a wonderful guy, and Judy knows there's someone who's compatible, because Judy is loud, obnoxious, semi-involved, a slob, emotionally unavailable, a bizarre dresser, and her friends say Judy is a perfect catch at least for some psychopath out there.
Nick used to regularly take the bus to Patti's house in the city so they could visit and hang out, but he doesn't anymore because: She had a family reunion coming up sometime in the fall.

Judy usually makes a nice dinner for her husband on Fridays before he gets home, because Judy only works half a day on Fridays, but Judy didn't this week, because: He was away on a work trip, but Judy will make it up on Sunday when he gets back.
Judy usually studies for Spanish tests with her best friend but Judy'll not going to study for the next test with her because her best friend told her that she isn't going to take Spanish anymore.
Nick is justified in expecting Bob to loan him his car for the next three years because Bob will not be using it for a few days and Nick has loaned Bob his car on several occasions.

Nick deserves to make himself a fresh pot of coffee, because Nick is working hard and wishes to consume caffeine, and that coffee in the pot has been sitting there too long, plus Nick buys the coffee.
Nick usually doesn't allow Bob to drive his car, but he decided to let him do so today because Bob promised to wash it and to fill up the gas tank when he was done with it.

As a remote worker, Nick is justified in expecting to have some time flexibility about his work hours, because he can choose work when he wants, and he expects that the jobs he likes best will always be there.

Nick is justified in expecting that if he keeps working hard and saving, that he'll be able to upgrade to a newer car within the next year if he decides to, because his current car is a quality brand and still in pretty good condition.

Nick used to regularly take long road trips with Joel, but Nick doesn't anymore because: He is doing plenty of traveling from what Nick hears, and seeing the direction he went with his life, it's a good thing they split.

Judy deserves to have her husband celebrate their 20th anniversary, and be delighted to go on a special vacation, because Judy does not see what the problem is with serving him with surprise divorce papers on their anniversary?

Judy typically goes to a big music festival with her best friend Patti, but she didn't this year because: Her mother forbade her to ever go again after they hitchhiked there that time when they were 16.

Nick usually establishes classroom rules and routines on the first day of school but he didn't do that for Miles because Miles was in a car accident and was in the hospital for the first two months of school.
